description: A vRtrIgmpIfRxQueryVerMismatch notification is generated when the
IGMP interface is configured as IGMPv3 but the router receives a
IGMPv1 Query or IGMPv2 General Query on the interface.
vRtrIfIndex will identify the router interface on which the query is
received. vRtrIgmpIfAdminVersion will contain the configured
version of the interface and vRtrIgmpNotifyQueryVersion
will contain the version of the received query.
objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpIfRxQueryVerMismatch TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID i 9999 TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfIndex i 9999 TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpIfAdminVersion u 9999 TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpNotifyQueryVersion u 9999

description: The unique value which identifies this virtual router in the Tmnx
system. The vRtrID value for each virtual router must remain
constant at least from one re-initialization of the system
management processor (CPM) to the next. There will always be at
least one router entry defined by the agent with vRtrID=1 which
represents the transport router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID

description: The unique value which identifies this interface of this virtual
router in the Tmnx system. This field provides an identifier for
virtual router interfaces similar to the ifIndex values used in the
mib-2 interfaces table for physical interfaces. The vRtrIfIndex values
can be reused for different virtual routers, but are unique within
those entries with the same vRtrID.
The vRtrIfIndex value for each virtual interface must remain constant
at least from one re-initialization of the system management processor
to the next.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfIndex

description: The configured version of IGMP which is running on this interface.
This object can be used to configure a router capable of
running either value. For IGMP to function correctly, all
routers on a LAN must be configured to run the same version
of IGMP on that LAN.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpIfAdminVersion

description: vRtrIgmpNotifyQueryVersion is used by vRtrIgmpIfRxQueryVerMismatch
to notify the version of the query received by the router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpNotifyQueryVersion

description: A vRtrIgmpIfCModeRxQueryMismatch notification is generated
when there is a mismatch between the compatible mode of the interface
and the version of the received query.
It is generated when the IGMP interface is in IGMPv1 compatible mode
but it receives a IGMPv2 or IGMPv3 Query on the interface. It is also
generated when the compatibility mode of the interface is IGMPv2
but the query received is IGMPv3.
vRtrIfIndex will identify the router interface on which the query is
received. vRtrIgmpIfOperVersion will indicate the compatibility mode
of the interface and vRtrIgmpNotifyQueryVersion will contain the
version of the received query.

event.Summary: IGMP compatible mode of interface ($v3) and version of received query ($v4) mismatched

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpIfCModeRxQueryMismatch TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID i 9999 TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfIndex i 9999 TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpIfOperVersion u 9999 TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpNotifyQueryVersion u 9999

description: The unique value which identifies this virtual router in the Tmnx
system. The vRtrID value for each virtual router must remain
constant at least from one re-initialization of the system
management processor (CPM) to the next. There will always be at
least one router entry defined by the agent with vRtrID=1 which
represents the transport router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrID

description: The unique value which identifies this interface of this virtual
router in the Tmnx system. This field provides an identifier for
virtual router interfaces similar to the ifIndex values used in the
mib-2 interfaces table for physical interfaces. The vRtrIfIndex values
can be reused for different virtual routers, but are unique within
those entries with the same vRtrID.
The vRtrIfIndex value for each virtual interface must remain constant
at least from one re-initialization of the system management processor
to the next.
variables.name: TIMETRA-VRTR-MIB::vRtrIfIndex

description: The operational version of IGMP which is running on this interface.
If the value of vRtrIgmpIfAdminVersion is configured as '3' but
all of the routers in the local subnet of this interface use IGMP
version v1 or v2, the operational version will be v1 or v2.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpIfOperVersion

description: vRtrIgmpNotifyQueryVersion is used by vRtrIgmpIfRxQueryVerMismatch
to notify the version of the query received by the router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpNotifyQueryVersion

description: The vRtrIgmpMaxGrpsLimitExceeded event is generated when an attempt is
made to configure a group when vRtrIgmpIfGroupCount, the number of
groups configured on the PIM interface, is equal to vRtrIgmpIfMaxGroups,
the maximum number of groups supported on the system.
The value of vRtrIgmpIfMaxGroups specifies the maximum number of groups
for which IGMP can have local receiver information based on received
IGMP reports on this interface. When this configuration is changed
dynamically to a value lower than currently accepted number of groups
the groups that are already accepted are not deleted. Only new groups
will not be allowed. When this object has a value of 0, there is no
limit to the number of groups.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpIfMaxGroups

description: The vRtrIgmpMcacPlcyDropped event is generated when an
IGMP group is dropped on a given interface because of
applying a multicast CAC policy given by vRtrIgmpIfMcacPolicyName.

event.Summary: IGMP group is dropped on interface because of applied multicast CAC policy ($v1)

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpMcacPlcyDropped TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpIfMcacPolicyName s EXAMPLE TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpNotifyGrpAddrType i 0 TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpNotifyGrpAddr s EXAMPLE

description: The value of vRtrIgmpIfMcacPolicyName specifies the name
of the multicast CAC policy.
The multicast cac policy applies the interface cac algorithm if
the channel(group) on this interface is part of the policy as specified
in vRtrIgmpIfMcacPolicyName.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpIfMcacPolicyName

description: The value of the object vRtrIgmpNotifyGrpAddrType indicates
the type of vRtrIgmpNotifyGrpAddr.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpNotifyGrpAddrType

description: The value of the object vRtrIgmpNotifyGrpAddr indicates
the multicast group address.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpNotifyGrpAddr

description: The vRtrIgmpHostInstantiationFail event is generated when a
host is eligible for running IGMP, but IGMP cannot be started on the host.
The sysUpTime when this row was last modified.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpGrpIfHostLastChangeTime

description: The object vRtrIgmpNotifyDescription is a printable character
string.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpNotifyDescription

description: The vRtrIgmpMaxGrpsLimitExceeded event is generated when an attempt is
made to configure a group when vRtrIgmpHostGroupCount, the number of
groups configured on the PIM interface, is equal to vRtrIgmpHostMaxGroups,
the maximum number of groups supported on the system.

event.Summary: IGMP host maximum groups limit ($v3) exceeded

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpHostMaxGrpsLimitExceeded TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpHostFwdSvcId u 9999 TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpHostGrpIfId i 9999 TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpHostMaxGroups u 9999

description: The value of vRtrIgmpHostFwdSvcId specifies the forwarding
service ID for a subscriber interface in a retailer
context.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpHostFwdSvcId

description: The value of vRtrIgmpHostGrpIfId specifies the forwarding
group interface.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpHostGrpIfId

description: The value of vRtrIgmpHostMaxGroups specifies the maximum number of groups
for which IGMP can have local receiver information based on received
IGMP reports on this subscriber host. When this configuration is changed
dynamically to a value lower than currently accepted number of groups
the groups that are already accepted are not deleted. Only new groups
will not be allowed. When this object has a value of 0, there is no
limit to the number of groups.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpHostMaxGroups

description: The vRtrIgmpHostMcacPlcyDropped event is generated when an
IGMP group is dropped on a given Host because of
applying a multicast CAC policy given by vRtrIgmpNotifyMcacPolicyName.

event.Summary: IGMP group is dropped on host because of applied multicast CAC policy ($v1)

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpHostMcacPlcyDropped TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpHostSubscriberId s EXAMPLE TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpNotifyMcacPolicyName s EXAMPLE TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpNotifyGrpAddrType i 0 TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpNotifyGrpAddr s EXAMPLE

description: The value of vRtrIgmpHostSubscriberId indicates
the subscriber identification of this subscriber host.
This must be an existing subscriber.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpHostSubscriberId

description: The value of vRtrIgmpNotifyMcacPolicyName specifies the name of the
multicast CAC policy.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpNotifyMcacPolicyName

description: The value of the object vRtrIgmpNotifyGrpAddrType indicates
the type of vRtrIgmpNotifyGrpAddr.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpNotifyGrpAddrType

description: The value of the object vRtrIgmpNotifyGrpAddr indicates
the multicast group address.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpNotifyGrpAddr

description: A vRtrIgmpHostCModeRxQueryMismatch notification is generated
when there is a mismatch between the compatible mode of the IGMP Host
and the version of the received query.
It is generated when the Host is in IGMPv1 compatible mode
but it receives a IGMPv2 or IGMPv3 Query. It is also
generated when the compatibility mode of the Host is IGMPv2
but the query received is IGMPv3.
vRtrIgmpHostAddress will identify the Host on which the query is
received. vRtrIgmpHostOperVersion will indicate the compatibility mode
of the Host and vRtrIgmpNotifyQueryVersion will contain the
version of the received query.

event.Summary: IGMP host compatible mode received query version ($v2) mismatched

description: The operational version of IGMP which is running for this host.
If the value of vRtrIgmpIfAdminVersion is configured as '3' but
all of the routers in the local subnet of this interface use IGMP
version v1 or v2, the operational version will be v1 or v2.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpHostOperVersion

description: vRtrIgmpNotifyQueryVersion is used by vRtrIgmpIfRxQueryVerMismatch
to notify the version of the query received by the router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpNotifyQueryVersion

description: A vRtrIgmpHostRxQueryVerMismatch notification is generated when the
IGMP host is configured as IGMPv3 but receives a
IGMPv1 Query or IGMPv2 General Query on the host.
vRtrIgmpHostAddress will identify the Host on which the query is
received. vRtrIgmpHostAdminVersion will contain the configured
version of the Host and vRtrIgmpNotifyQueryVersion
will contain the version of the received query.

event.Summary: IGMP host receives query version ($v2) mismatched

description: The configured version of IGMP which is running for this Host.
For IGMP to function correctly, all routers on a LAN must be configured
to run the same version of IGMP on that LAN.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpHostAdminVersion

description: vRtrIgmpNotifyQueryVersion is used by vRtrIgmpIfRxQueryVerMismatch
to notify the version of the query received by the router.
variables.name: TIMETRA-IGMP-MIB::vRtrIgmpNotifyQueryVersion
